Should we move forward with this PR? It renames docs#Topology.RestrictGenTopology to Topology.IsRestrictGen with the goal to:

  • deduplicate the Topology in the name
  • prefix the name with Is to show it's Prop-valued

Yaël Dillies said:

Should we move forward with this PR? It renames docs#Topology.RestrictGenTopology to Topology.IsRestrictGen with the goal to:

  • deduplicate the Topology in the name
  • prefix the name with Is to show it's Prop-valued

Yes
:ping_pong:
I dislike the long name, which has Topology in it twice.
@Steven Clontz Is there a standard name for "restructions of the topology to the elements of a cover generate the original topology"?
As in the topology induced by a cover as a subbasis?
Or I guess, the cover is a subbasis for the original topology? I should read up thread
So "compactly generated" and "finitely generated" are the only specific examples coming to mind off hand.
I think, it's nice to have "restriction" somewhere in the name, because we aren't talking about TopologicalSpace.generateFrom s = inst.

Ah, I see - that seems to be the notion of generation from a subbasis I thought you might have been asking about earlier.

I suppose I hadn't thought about it before, but "generated by the [sub]basis" and "[property]ly-generated" does seem to overload the word "generate" here. I agree some disambiguation is necessary, but I don't think "restriction" is the right word here.
My new hot take: Topology.IsCoherentWith (and, though it's likely not worth changing, I'd prefer TopologicalSpace.generateFromSubbasis for disambiguation)
